title: The Lost Tomb
data:
**The Lost Tomb** is a special level in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is accessed by a stairway down that appears between levels 21 and 24 in SLASH'EM and between levels 5 to 25 in dNetHack and SpliceHack.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Level

                    --------                       
                    |..$...|                       
                    |......|                       
                    ----.---                       
                        #                          
                        #                          
                   -----[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")----           ---------  
       --------    |........|           |.......|  
       |......|-----........|-----------|.......|  
       |[<](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase").....[+](/wiki/Door "Door").............[+](/wiki/Door "Door")...........[+](/wiki/Door "Door")......[L](/wiki/Lich "Lich")|  
       |......[+](/wiki/Door "Door").............[+](/wiki/Door "Door")...........[+](/wiki/Door "Door")......$|  
       |......|-----........|-----------|.......|  
       --------    |........|           |.......|  
                   ----[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")-----           ---------  
                       #                           
                       #                           
                    ---.----                       
                    |......|                       
                    |...$..|                       
                    --------                     

Monster generation in the Tomb is biased toward chaotic monsters; all random monsters are [Z](/wiki/Zombie_\(monster_class\) "Zombie (monster class)") and [M](/wiki/Mummy "Mummy"). There is a [lich](/wiki/Lich "Lich") in the room on the far right, generated on top of a pile of treasure containing a random amount of [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold"), a [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest"), four random [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll"), three random [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion"), and two other random objects. In dNetHack, the treasure piles in the far right room also contain 4 potions of [unholy water](/wiki/Unholy_water "Unholy water").

The $ marks indicate other caches of treasure- the one on the right contains a chest, a random amount of gold, four random scrolls, four random spellbooks, and the ones on the top and bottom both contain a chest and three random objects.

The level also contains fourteen [shadows](/wiki/Shadow "Shadow"), nineteen random Z, eleven random M, one random item, and four [spiked pits](/wiki/Spiked_pit "Spiked pit"), all placed at random.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## See also

- [Special level (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Special_level_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Special level (SLASH'EM)")
- [SpliceHack/Special levels](/wiki/SpliceHack/Special_levels "SpliceHack/Special levels")
- [User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches "User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches")

## Reference

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) <https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/dat/dungeon.lua>
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) <https://github.com/k21971/SlashEM/blob/master/dat/tomb.des>
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) <https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/dat/tomb.lua>

html:
The Lost Tomb

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The Lost Tomb is a special level in SLASH'EM, dNetHack, SpliceHack, SlashTHEM, and Hack'EM. It is accessed by a stairway down that appears between levels 21 and 24 in SLASH'EM and between levels 5 to 25 in dNetHack and SpliceHack.[1]

Level

                    --------                     
                    |..$...|                     
                    |......|                     
                    ----.---                     
                        #                        
                        #                        
                   -----S----           ---------
       --------    |........|           |.......|
       |......|-----........|-----------|.......|
       |<.....+.............+...........+......L|
       |......+.............+...........+......$|
       |......|-----........|-----------|.......|
       --------    |........|           |.......|
                   ----S-----           ---------
                       #                         
                       #                         
                    ---.----                     
                    |......|                     
                    |...$..|                     
                    --------                     

Monster generation in the Tomb is biased toward chaotic monsters; all random monsters are Z and M. There is a lich in the room on the far right, generated on top of a pile of treasure containing a random amount of gold, a chest, four random scrolls, three random potions, and two other random objects. In dNetHack, the treasure piles in the far right room also contain 4 potions of unholy water.

The $ marks indicate other caches of treasure- the one on the right contains a chest, a random amount of gold, four random scrolls, four random spellbooks, and the ones on the top and bottom both contain a chest and three random objects.

The level also contains fourteen shadows, nineteen random Z, eleven random M, one random item, and four spiked pits, all placed at random.[2][3]

See also

  • Special level (SLASH'EM)
  • SpliceHack/Special levels
  • User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches

Reference

  1. ↑ https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/dat/dungeon.lua
  2. ↑ https://github.com/k21971/SlashEM/blob/master/dat/tomb.des
  3. ↑ https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/dat/tomb.lua

It is accessed by a stairway down that appears between levels 21 and 24 in SLASH'EM and between levels 5 to 25 in dNetHack and SpliceHack.https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/dat/dungeon.lua ==Level==

In dNetHack, the treasure piles in the far right room also contain 4 potions of [[unholy water]]. The {{yellow|$}} marks indicate other caches of treasure- the one on the right contains a chest, a random amount of gold, four random scrolls, four random spellbooks, and the ones on the top and bottom both contain a chest and three random objects.
